author: kilonp97
title: Given confidence
body:
I was referred to a Registered Mental Health Nurse for 8 weekly sessions to meet the objectives of improving my mood so that I would be more willing and able to go outdoors without feeling anxious and nervous.  
Prior to commencing my online meetings I was very sceptical about attending this specialist type of treatment as I really felt I could cope on my own and that I would not benefit from someone telling me what or how to do things to make me feel and cope better. I felt it would be difficult for me to open up and speak to someone.  
However, I have really enjoyed the sessions with my RMN who has been so kind, considerate and compassionate from day one. She made me feel at ease from day one and I feel I have built up a great rapport with her which led me to looking forward to and enjoying each session. It takes a special type of person to fulfill the role of those designated to do this job and my RMN certainly, without a doubt, is one of these genuine and caring nurses.  
My sessions have been very beneficial and by showing me different strategies, frameworks and techniques you have helped me to retrain my thoughts by implementing them and value their importance and use. They also helped me realise I did have a purpose in life which had been a big trigger point of my depression and thus a big benefit on the road to my recovery. Realising through talking and using the tools the cause, depth and manifestation has helped me to have a different and better outlook on life. Due to everything you gave me over the weeks it has gave me lots of benefits which has enabled me to move on, get over past hardships and as I feel so much better since I started my treatment I am able to look to the future. You were able to detect at the first session just how severely depressed I was which I was in denial of but when you compare my mental state now from then the proof of how these sessions work are there to see.  
Thank you for all your help and kindness.  
There are no negative comments about my treatment as I know and feel we have met all the objectives set at our first meeting. I am just a little sad there is no follow up to check all is going well but the treatment has given me the confidence to get help when/if I realise I am needing it.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Great Care
body: Attended A&E  was triage  quickly , by 2 lovely members of staff . Very well organised rooms to move you too in regards your stages of assessment. Sandwiches / tea and coffee provided during my wait also at tea time which was very much appreciated. District Doctor and Nurse who attended to me  on the ward I was on for a few hours were fabulous and caring and compassionate. Thank you for  taking care of me . 😊

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Kind people who listen to the patient
body: I came in with acute sciatic pain and was seen by a doctor within 2.5 hours. The nurses were all kind, patient and empathetic and the doctor listened to my past experiences of back pain and prescribed pain relief while giving clear advice and instructions on what to do next. I really appreciated everyone’s calm and empathetic manner and the fact that my own opinions and experiences were listened to.

title: Caring GP
body: Dr Aggarwal is a knowledgeable and very caring doctor. He is always working in the best interest of his patients. He has a kind personality and will go beyond the call of duty to help his patients. My family is very lucky to have him looking after us.

title: Great!
body: Well done to all the staff in A&E, Qeqm hospital today. Receptionist, cleaners, obs, HCA, triage, booking in staff, Doctors, Nurses, Paramedics, Consultants and Interns. Well done and thank you for all you do. Complimentary drinks station most welcome.  Yes there was a long wait, but due to the sheer volume of patients. Keep up the good work. Thank you.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

author: Jean4
title: Follow up consultation
body:
I had to rebook my appointment with ENT as it was our daughters graduation . The original appointment was a telephone consultation. I was surprised to find the new appointment was face to face but was pleased as my symptoms had become significantly worse since my original tests.  
I arrived at the hospital which was clearly indicated on my letter that I was to attend the department at pilgrim hospital only to find that I had been sent the wrong letter and in actual fact my appointment was a phone call! The staff did arrange for me to use one of their rooms to take the call which lasted all of a few minutes. But considering where I live and it was a 60 mile round trip I had not only wasted my time but also a considerable amount of money on fuel! Apparently the mistake is a usual occurrence. This needs looking at especially in the current financial situation!

title: Very helpful staff
body: I rang at 8am and was caller no 1 so hardly had to wait to speak to someone.  The man who answered the phone was very patient and helpful and offered my husband an appointment at a time to suit him.  The GP we saw was extremely pleasant, knowledgeable and helpful and took her time to answer all our questions and explain what she was going to do.  We left feeling that everything had been dealt with satisfactorily.

title: What an amazing hospital
body:
Everyone was fantastic. A big thank you to the entire team of porters,. nurses and doctors
 What an excellent job you all do.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

author: tigerpn68
title: Failure to follow up reports
body:
I have a long term condition and I am clinically vulnerable and am under the care of a local hospital. For whatever reason there has been a serious problem going on for several weeks because the GP says it hasn't received the Consultant report which tells them to change medication and make additional referrals because apparently only the GP can do that. This is now the 3rd time in 15 months this has happened.  
I spoke to a GP who couldn't treat me because of this. They said that it wasn't their job to chase reports and it is up to the patient to do this, begging the question exactly what do the admin management team there do and why is this policy in place as it can only harm?  
Surely this is the job of the GP admin team to chase up because I have called everyone I can and there is only so much I can do; I don't understand all the ways the NHS communicates and the GP does. It feels like all the time I get bounced between the two and at the same time my health is getting worse. I can't do this I feel too unwell .  
It turns out that there is a direct email and telephone number the GP can use for the hospital GP liaison team that the public cant use. So the practice keeps telling me and other patients it is our responsibility to chase when all this time they could have contacted this team.

author: aquariusgz87
title: Peterhead MIU
body:
I attended Peterhead MIU with chest pain (severe, was in tears) in the early evening. On arrival, doors were open, so I entered the department. I was quickly met by a nurse. I explained my chest infection - had 1 week of antibiotics, on 2nd week and whenever I took got chest pain/upper abdominal pain after, severe in nature. I was told to go home and phone 111. The department was not busy  
Instead, I stayed in the department (although locked outside by double doors) as I didn't want an ambulance sent for pain - as happened previously  
Attitude from nurse was awful and made me feel so upset. Not once did she check on me, knowing I was outside doors, in case condition worsened.

author: irregularitywd75
title: CT scan
body: I was taken 5 minutes early for my morning appointment. This is the second time I’ve had x rays at Omagh complex. The service and professionalism of the staff were outstanding. They made me feel at ease throughout the procedure.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: delphinushw35
title: Hysteroscopy, endometrial & fibroid polypectomy
body:
I had a hysteroscopy, endometrial & fibroid polypectomy today and I observed the day surgery unit I was admitted to.  
The nurses had the unit running like clockwork and I was in and out before 12 noon all checked feeling very safe and informed. I even got to speak to the anaesthetist who was lovely and very reassuring.  
I want to point out that my nurses were absolutely amazing and deserve recognition as they made me feel safe and at ease but most of all efficient. Well done Laura and everyone else who took great care of me today.  
Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

author: DavidH
title: Prompt Attention
body:
At a group session at Cumnock Hospital East Ayrshire, while having lunch took a choking spasm and the nurses/carers were there in seconds.  
Totally professional and efficient.

author: earmarksw74
title: IUD procedure
body:
Had my first IUD fitted today. Dr Bretland and the wonderful nurse whose name i didnt catch made what could have been a very awkward and uncomfortable proceedure very dignified. 

Upon learning on my hearing impairment they made sure I understood what was happening at each step and did not rush me. The care they took to make me comfortble at each step eased my nerves. Their encouragment helped me get through the mild discomfort. Also after everything was done they gave me space to get myself back together until I was ready to face the rest of my day.

Thank you both for my peace of mind and the dignity you afforded me.

title: Removed repeat prescriptions with no consultation
body:
The surgery removed the repeat prescriptions from my wife which she relies on to manage her skin condition and asthma with no consultation or contact - we found out from our pharmacy. She has now run out of essential medications. She tried several times to contact the surgery via telephone and spent hours in queues to no avail. In the end after spending 45 minutes stuck at number 2 in a queue I drove her up to the surgery where the receptionist informed us that there were two people answering phones - she pointed to two empty seats behind her which was quite comical. No one picked up a phone in the 15 minutes we were there, so the phones - during the time they advertise us to call in, after 10am - had been left unmanned for over an hour. There may be a lack of gp's, but there is not a lack of receptionists in the uk - It not hard, you are obviously making excessive profit running a service at its bare bones - employ more.

As regards the prescription, we were told the items needed to be re authorised, which will take 5 days. I do not have confidence this will be done, but we will see.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: MAM63
title: Professional and caring service
body: We had to attend Outpatients Clinic at Altnagelvin recently, clinic 4, what a service, the professional and caring manner of  the Dr  and nurse Ruth, who helped ease our  anxiety.   We had to attend a few clinics while there for tests, and everyone of them showed the same care,  this dept in Altnagelvin is exceptional, thank you for your care, and professionalism you are a credit to the Health Service.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Care has been at a high level
body: The care that I have seen in the hospital has been pretty good so far and I cannot complain about a single thing I have seen with my care as it has been at such a high level. The doctors have been brilliant so far and I have been able to understand them all so far. The nurses have been well and truly great not a bad word I could say about them at all. The foods been great and I have had no issues at all with the care I have got.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff have all been incredible
body: The care in the hospital has been absolutely excellent so far and that is down to the incredible staff the hospital has. The staff are so good so far and they honestly couldn’t be nicer. They are all absolutely fantastic at what they do and I know that I can rely on them 100 percent which I am very thankful for. I am able to understand them all very easily thanks to how clearly they talk. The foods great i really enjoy it. I Have had no issues at all and am very happy with my care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: No real issues so far
body: My care in the hospital has been pretty good so far and thanks to the staff I have had no real issues with the care that I have been receiving so far at least. The staff have all been pretty decent so far can’t really complain about a single one of them as I have been able to understand all of them so far. The food in the hospital has been pretty alright so far and thanks to all the staff I have been left happy enough with my care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Attitudes need to change
body: My care has not been the best so far and I feel that there are a few problems with the care so far. This is due to some of the attitudes of the staff members I have looking after me. Their attitudes are often quite poor and to be honest leave a lot to be desired which is quite difficult to deal with. I am able to understand them all right when they explain things which is nice in keeping updated. The food I can’t say a bad word about it it’s just been some people’s attitudes that’s the issue.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: EdG22
title: Link between ongoing mental health and addiction
body: I was going through the same cycle for decades, I have finally been able to get the help n diagnosis I had been badly needing all along, and for that alone I am forever grateful.

author: Louie22
title: My mums care
body:
My elderly mother was admitted to Crosshouse Hospital in Kilmarnock after a very bad fall down a flight of stairs . After a lengthy wait in A and E I went home. I was called by the doctor and told she would require various tests and scans. I was told I would be contacted first thing in the morning  
No communication! I tried to get through for 20 mins to eventually be told nothing had changed just the same injuries. I said I knew nothing and was incredibly upset to hear she had :  
3 spinal fractures  
Head injury  
Haemothorax  
UTI and covid  
She was taken to the surgical receiving ward 4A and had to be put into isolation.Communication is shocking, when you ask to speak to the staff I feel it is evident they can’t be bothered  
I found out by chance the other day she also has a flail chest /4 broken ribs  
I know they are incredibly stressed and short staffed and morale is low but how would they feel if that was their mother?  
Her eyesight is poor so she can’t read a book.  
I asked a nurse to check if her TV was working, to be told it probably wasn’t. I asked again if she would check, same reply. I was told I would need to get her an iPad  
Mum needed a bed pan, she can’t get out of bed, only to be told by a clinical support worker that she wasn’t the only patient on the ward and she would have to wait.  
I know things are bad in the NHS but when did the compassion go?  
I now have Covid and cannot visit my mum. There is just mum and I. So I call her and every time I call she cries and tells me she can’t take it anymore, it’s awful, like prison, she just wants to die.  
I called the ward again to be answered with that’s a wee shame, I told them I was worried about her mental health, same reply.  
Mum has now been moved to the orthopaedic ward and what a difference. Much better room, she has a view, still no TV but she has her iPad  
She is still in a bad way but I must praise a nurse called Jackie. I wish she could be cloned!!  
She listened to my concerns, made phone calls to check on things and she called me back. She spent time talking to mum and listened to her, no one has done that so far. She made small but significant changes which have lifted mums spirits greatly. She explained about little things they could do, when I feel no one else bothered  
So Jackie, thank you so very much, what a difference you have made!!  
We need to do something about the state of the NHS . We need to boost staff morale and staff numbers to help those staff who are so stressed and overworked they have forgotten how to care.  
To help retain staff because so many are leaving a profession they have been in for years.  
But thank you Jackie for restoring my faith.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: We could not ask for a better care team
body:
I came into accident and emergency with my son, it was okay. We were triaged very quick and just waited for results to be told that we were going to be admitted.  
The staff were very friendly down there and they keep you informed on updates with the results.  
Daisy ward has been excellent, my son has settled well, especially with all the colouring books and painting the nurses are bringing into him. The place is so modern and I love the way the rooms are private and we have an en-suite. The bed for the parent is a bit uncomfortable since it’s a chair leaned back, hope we are not here for long or my back will be very sore.  
The staff are so nice and really good with my son. They must love their jobs and their attitudes toward it are outstanding, we could not ask for a better care team.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: stonezf59
title: kind and caring nurse
body:
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']  
[Very happy with 'Being listened to']  
[Very happy with 'Calling for help']  
[Very happy with 'Nurses']

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Bridgeton
title: Slowness of learning diagnosis
body:
Appreciating the problems after the pandemic I am extremely concerned for my husband, family and myself regarding the current delay we are experiencing for receiving the outcome of a special test my husband had at the end of June. Our hospital appointment for the results is not until mid-September. Our life recently has been one of extreme worry and concern.  
After the test, we have been playing the waiting game and imagining the worst outcomes from the test. I had to contact our GP who tried to help us get an earlier appointment for the diagnosis. I also phoned the department to try and get an earlier appointment but there has been no response from the hospital.  
I feel like complaining but understand the pressures the NHS is under just now. However, we have a story to tell and would like to talk this through with someone regarding our situation. I am a retired nurse, which doesn’t help matters, but fortunately my training has helped hopefully for supporting my husband and family at this worrying time

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: It is all so exciting
body:
I am just after my 12 weeks scan, it was very exciting. I was just glad everything was good and the baby is healthy. Everything went smoothly and everyone was so nice. The only annoying thing was that the day of our scan before it was cancelled only a few hours in advance and they rang me on no caller ID so I was not going to answer, good thing I did or I would have come to the hospital for no reason. The equipment looked new enough and the place was very clean where I got the scan.  
The staff were so nice, they told me all what to expect and what was going to happen. They told me about an app that will show you what stage and size the baby is at. I cannot complain about anything, especially getting the pictures from the scan, it is all so exciting.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: M00se
title: Caring, professional, efficient staff at MIU
body: Brought my mum to MIU when she had hurt her foot. The staff were caring, professional and efficient. Thank you to all of the team in the MIU.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: whibsib
title: We are very lucky to have you.
body:
Attended A&E in Daisy Hill Hospital after first contacting the urgent care number. I was in excruciating pain & was quickly triaged & given pain relief.  
I then had bloods done & was reviewed by Dr King. A scan was ordered & after a little wait I was seen by the gynae doctors before being sent home on medication.  
All the staff were so helpful & pleasant both in A&E & on female surgical. Thank you all for you continued hard work in a relentlessly busy environment.  
We are very lucky to have you.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Not the best experience overall
body:
I came up to accident and emergency after my GP referred me as I was having a stroke. My family member took me up and I had to wait 4 hours to get the injection.  
The staff sort of faffed off my family member when they kept asking what was happening as waiting 4 hours is a very long time while having a stroke. Other than that the staff were okay. The other bad thing was how long I had to wait on a bed it was diabolical.  
Stroke and rehab has been fine, I just want to go home. After the treatment in accident and emergency I do not want to be here even though this ward has not done a thing wrong.  
The staff are lovely up here and try to do the best for me and work with me.  
Not the best experience overall.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have been nothing but kind
body:
I came in by ambulance, so do not remember much of accident and emergency.  
Stroke and rehab has been fine, I can feel myself improving with all the physio and occupational therapy I am getting. The ward is relatively quiet and I get peace most if the day until the nurses come and check my blood pressure and things. It is just a bit scary thinking this can happen again, stresses me out a bit. The ward is so clean I have to say and you always see the cleaners in and out of the wards.  
The staff have been nothing but kind, they have a laugh with you also which I am glad of. I just wish we could have visitors every day and you did not have to book, but hopefully we are heading that way.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Christine duffy
title: Epilepsy Diagnosis
body:
I have several different seizures; partial, full body, black outs, a lot of different kinds.  
About a year ago got an ambulance to the house and the trained paramedic said I had epilepsy and told me she was trained in this, I got referred to two consultants .  
The one I saw today says they don't think I've got epilepsy and I've to go into hospital for a few weeks to get a scan of my brainwaves.  
My witnesses have found me and saw me jerking up and down in a seizure

title: Excellent service
body: Been to northern general a&e a few times over last few years doctors. Nurses and receptionist and all staff have been excellent so through and caring and good communication. Real bonus  helps thing move a lot quicker  . Good hospital they work so so hard thank you northern general

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Life savers
body: If it wasn't for staff at the surgery I would have been so poorly but they looked after me so well specially after my cancer  they are kind and understanding from the receptionists to the nurses and doctors. Thank you .

title: Super service, great staff
body: I fell and hurt my leg whist staying in Keswick. All the staff here were just lovely! The place is so clean and well kept, clearly the staff take a lot of pride in where they work. They even made me a cup of tea, unheard of at any practice in our home town! A shining example of how all the NHS should operate.

title: V helpful visit
body: Friendly staff and helpful professional doctor, 1st visit since before covid and felt reassured the service is still operating well.

title: The best staff
body: I can not express how happy I was to be cared for by the most amazing staff. They were kind, caring and so supportive. I felt in safe hands all the way through my induction, birth and recovery. They made my birth experience so positive. Thank you a million times over!

title: Professional and great oractice
body: Spent 24 hours in Wensleydale ward after surgery. Great staff from catering to consultant always kept you informed. Could not fault my experience.

author: Local user
title: Access to wards
body: I have been visiting a friend in ward 29 at the RIG Glasgow. Throughout these two weeks at least one of the lifts ( SB1) has been out of order. On at least one day both  lifts SB1 and SB2) were both out of order. I have witnessed hours of time wasted by staff and patients. It is extremely concerning for elderly visitors and patients with mobility issues to negotiate the stairs. Local staff apologise constantly for the failings. However there is no sign on the lift to say it is out of order nor any apology or explanation when it may be fixed.  This week local staff (overheard chatting) said  the lift will  not be fixed until October. I wonder if  given how busy and short staff are, how much more time will be wasted as a result of the lift continuing to be out of order? II wonder if (given the profile of visitors to south block wards) have to  delay visiting loved ones due to accessibility issues? I wonder about how delays  in staff moving equipment and patients impacts on their care? I wonder if the matter has been reported and if so why is there no explanation apology or plan published on each floor to explain why such a vital function in the hospital is not available? This is also compounded by south doors being inexplicably out of order.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Great Treatment
body:
I was admitted to hospital on the 16/8. Lots of tests, great attention. Caring staff. Diagnosed with pancreatitis and transferred to a Surgical Ward. Eventually had gall bladder out.  Faultless treatment throughout. 
Staff professional and caring.

readBy.name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Superb service in circumstances
body: Assured re diagnosis and treatment required. Photos taken and submitted to dermatology with prompt diagnosis and treatment to be undertaken. Also given concise instructions re follow up

title: Helpful reception
body: Phoned up to enquire about getting access to my records. Wasn't on hold too long and the reception team were helpful, friendly and sorted the issue easily.

title: Care like no other
body:
I have had open heart surgery and wound up with a nasty infection in my leg. As people moan about the NHS my experience has been the opposite, I couldn't have asked or hoped for more, every member of the team including the pharmacy helped me well beyond the expectations.

The Doctor whom I would love to name has simply been the most caring and dedicated Doctor I have ever known, I've been seen weekly with an open appointment if something changes, there is nothing left to chance, I feel so blessed to be in this practice whom ever is in charge is doing an amazing job in truly terrible times.

I want to thank each and everyone absolutely everyone has helped me more than I thought was possible.

title: Great experience overall
body: I’d developed an unknown allergy and went to the Accident and emergency. They took my vitals, gave me some meds to alleviate the condition and everything was done within minutes. I was asked to wait to get checked up but had to leave on my own after a few hours because I was feeling drowsy from the medication. I would like to emphasise that the wait isn’t an issue as usually there’s a wait time of 3-4 hours and they deal with cases based on severity. I was feeling all right so I left but can’t complain about the level of care and treatment the practice offers even when overwhelmed with multiple emergencies. A big thank you to everyone in the practice.

title: Much kudos to the team
body:
We arrived at paediatric a&e at 5am traumatised and in shock after my son had suffered a finger amputation. Every single person we encountered, from the security guard to the nurses and specialist were all amazing and treated us with nothing but kindness. Totally above and beyond what we might have expected but definitely hoped for. My son was in a lot of pain but he received the best care, and was made as comfortable as possible.
This also extends to the aftercare received, wound dressings and occupational therapy totally professional. 
Couldn’t have asked for more. 
My son is doing great now and healing very well. Massive thankyou ! 🙏🙏🙏

readBy.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant practice
body:
I have always been treat with the utmost curtousy, from all the receptionists the GPs and the nurses.
They make you feel better sometimes just discussing  your problems, ailments ect. The practice is always kept very clean an tidy aswell. Which in this day and age is important.  Thank you to you all.

title: Fabulous professional service
body:
This was my first experience with this doctor at my practice 
She was amazing , understanding and helpful throughout .
A  wonderful asset to the surgery

title: Caring
body: The clinical pharmacist discussed my prescriptions and made changes, the reasons for the changes I completely understood. The discussion was very helpful.i had sufficient time to ask questions and share my concerns.

author: polarisqt69
title: Often feel rushed out the door
body: Some of the doctors are wonderful but others are dismissive/unhelpful and you often feel rushed out the door. It can be very hard to get an appointment or get through on the phone lines. Some of the reception staff are very rude and cold. Constantly see different doctors depending on who is working that day and who is available. Can be very hard to follow up on long term health problems or ongoing medical treatment because of the different staff. Male doctors won't help with anything specifically regarding women's health problems so two appointments are required instead of one. The Physio is lovely and very helpful. The health care assistant and nurse are very pleasant. I like that prescriptions can be delivered to local chemists. Frustrating and inconvenient that the nurse only works in the morning for getting certain tests done or leaving in samples. The recorded message is far too long on the phone lines. Can't leave any form of message for the GP which would improve care and communication.

readBy.name: Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Caring Staff
body: Within 3-4 weeks of being referred by optician I had my first cataract procedure and a week later the second. From the initial pre assessment to actual surgery the nurses and doctors were very caring. I was extremely nervous and was constantly being put at ease. Many thanks for a brilliant service I can  now colours so much clearer

title: Kind, caring and efficient staff
body:
I went in for a routine operation and had an overnight stay on Dilham ward.I was kept informed throughout and my were opinions respected. All staff I met introduced themselves and were kind, caring and friendly, yet professional. I spoke to all staff involved in my care. If I used my call bell someone was with me within around 2 minutes. Food was okay, not brilliant but it is hospital food! 
Giving general NHS staffing issues and stresses I was very impressed with the service received. I also received a follow up call from the discharge hub to check how I was doing a few days after discharge which was appreciated.
I would like to thank all Dilham ward staff for their care

readBy.name: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: July22
title: Care given to my mum
body:
My mum was admitted to Ninewells Hospital due to issues with mobility which we had thought was related to the fact that she was requiring a hip replacement due to severe osteoarthritis. However we were shocked to be given the diagnosis of lung cancer with bone & pulmonary metastasis and that palliative care was the only option.  
Mum was admitted to ward 6 from the acute medical ward for ongoing care. During her time on ward 6 mum received excellent care from one of the staff nurses. When this nurse was on shift and caring for my mum, a point was always made of updating us on mum’s condition and was always attentive to mum’s needs. They were kind, compassionate and professional at all times and is a credit to the ward. We are thankful that they were on shift a fair amount of time while mum was there as unfortunately our experience of care on ward 6 was not always positive.  
My mum was in a lot of pain but other than when the nurse mentioned was caring for mum her pain control was lacking. Most times we visited we had to ask for pain relief for mum and mum would say she couldn’t get staff’s attention as buzzer not always at hand.  
One particular day when I visited I found my mum lying on a dirty sheet and only partially covered by another also dirty sheet, she was in the same nightgown as the previous 2 days and as was the case a lot of times her IV infusion pump was alarming and not infusing. This really upset me as that is just basic care needs regardless of the fact it was a busy medical ward. My mum was bed ridden and totally dependent on staff for personal care and pain control and her condition was deteriorating rapidly. I decided at this point that I needed to make my feelings known and I asked to meet with medical staff too as mum’s pain relief was becoming more of a concern and she just wasn’t getting the care she needed and I felt she should be moved elsewhere. Thankfully I was listened to and the following day her first nurse was back caring for mum and phoned me first thing in the morning to say my concerns had been passed on and that a bed was available at Roxburghe House if I wanted mum moved. I was so relieved to hear this news and that this nurse was caring for mum again that day but I asked that they went ahead with the transfer.  
Mum was transferred to Roxburghe House and from admission until her sad passing she received outstanding care. All staff members were caring and compassionate and mum was finally comfortable and peaceful.

author: Teacher Mel
title: Highest praise for all of the staff
body:
Admitted today for wide incision and node removal for breast cancer. Highest praise for all staff- the whole day ran like clockwork. The lovely Yvonne had me checked in in jig time with lots of chat and humour along the way to keep me distracted!  
Miss Barker as always was supportive and informative, patiently guiding me through what the surgery would entail.  
Lovely Dominic the anaesthetist and his team were also amazing!  
What a great team and ward! Such camaraderie and a team who obviously get along, have fun and support one another. One nurse even loved Take That and did a little dance.  
Thanks to the Recovery Team too- on hand with plenty fluids and snacks as well as keeping a watchful eye on vital statistics (bp etc)  
Professional, friendly, supportive and reassuring service from start to finish.

author: Local user
title: The whole team pulled together
body: I attended for MRI and despite difficulties I felt the whole team pulled together to make my experience the best it could be. I wish to thank them for their lovely attitude and their compassion toward me You are a great team .

title: Thanks to the porters!
body: I was sent to the hospital for an x-ray after a very painful leg injury.  I was using a broom handle to help me walk, with a helping hand from my son, but was in a great deal of pain.  As we reached the main entrance a lovely, smiling, porter with a wheelchair greeted us, and wheeled me up to the imaging department, where I was seen within ten minutes.  The very helpful radiologist then rang for a porter, who kindly took me down to the area at the front of the hospital to get a taxi home.  I was quite moved by their kindness, and would like to thank them all for their help.

title: Fabulous professional service
body:
This was my first experience with this doctor at my practice 
She was amazing , understanding and helpful throughout .
A  wonderful asset to the surgery

author: Mr Hip legit
title: Staff at the hospital were fantastic
body:
I received a new hip at the end of August at Stracathro hospital from a Mr Boscainos.  
He was tremendous and the staff at the hospital were fantastic. The NHS are very professional and make you feel confident.

title: Very good people
body: The reception and medical staff are always helpful and pleasant as well as being knowledgeable and easy to talk to

author: Urs22
title: Gently reassured throughout
body: I attended Altnagelvin ENT department and was seen by my consultant. She introduced herself by her first name. I felt listened to,understood and was examined carefully. I received treatment and was gently reassured throughout. Shireen was just brilliant and we agreed a plan going forward. After months of worry I left the appointment feeling very positive. I am very grateful for the care I received today.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Great doctors surgery
body: My daughter was seen by one the GP’s at this surgery and all I can say is that I left feeling very happy and felt I had been listened to and my worries all taken on board.

title: Great doctors
body: Recommend highly they are very good always get back to me same day or next day never had a problem and when I have reception have always sorted it out for me.

title: Really good practice
body: The doctor are really good and helpful, I was seen by the hospital with in two weeks thanks to Conisbrough Group practice.

author: Davo84
title: A very good experience and home by lunch time
body:
All staff looking after me was amazing.  
Nurses, Consultants, anesthetist, assistants, students and even the receptionist. Everyone was friendly, put me at ease with lots of reassurance. Anesthetist got my procedure bumped up the list after listening to my concerns. All in all I had a very good experience and was home by lunch time. If only everyone was like these members of staff. Amazing.

author: Bea2022
title: Copper coil fitting
body:
I came to have the copper coil fitted and given that it's not a particularly pleasant experience, generally speaking, it was made so much better with Sehra and the blonde lady who was helping.  
They were both so lovely and kind and gentle and caring. They both made me feel very comfortable (even though I was coming on which could've been embarrassing) they put me at ease and were so thoughtful and considerate. I was so pleased to be given them to help me with having the coil fitted. Sehra also said it had gone in "beautifully" which is what you want to hear when these things are happening.  
So, I feel very cared for and special that it was such a pleasant time. There was no drama, no concern and no issues and it was also very quick.  
Thank you so much for being so amazing at your jobs and being such wonderful people.

author: #Basil1
title: Implant removed
body:
Felt my experience was done professionally and felt relaxed.
The nurse was newly qualified but felt comfortable throughout the minor procedure.
Happy with care I'd received.

author: Thankful P
title: Such a lovely team of staff, I felt cared for & in capable hands!
body:
Yesterday morning I took severe pains in my chest, they were debilitating.  
My sister drove me out to A & E in Omagh (cardiac care) & I was taken in straight away. Literally within minutes they were checking my ECG , heart rate & bloods were taken.  
The nurses were so lovely & explained everything that was happening. I felt so glad that this unit exists & the care and attention I received was exemplary!!  
Such a lovely team of staff , I felt cared for & in capable hands!  
Kindest regards to all the staff who looked after me , you are all amazing & a credit to Omagh Hospital .

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Very professional team
body: Amazing treatment from the pre op to the actual op,all staff very professional surgeon put me at ease, every where  is gleaming spotless ! I have no worries going back for my second cataract to be removed can’t wait !!

author: silverwaretm87
title: Fantastic support
body: Just wanted to thank the Enhanced Community Support Team especially Tracy who is a great asset.  They have been working with my mum who is very ill suffering with dementia.  My mum has had to be admitted to hospital twice and each time once home the team have been very good, they are friendly, thoughtful, approachable and always include all the family.

title: Excellent practice
body: All the various staff I have interacted over several visits have been incredibly flexible, supportive and helpful. Also one of the doctors correctly and rapidly diagnosed me with a condition that urgently needed treatment and which would have been easy to miss.

author: smith08
title: Wrist surgery
body: I received first class service from the day surgery ward at Wishaw  General, the team were amazing and the care I received was exemplary, just would like to thank the whole team once again 😊

title: Outstanding practice
body: Amazing service from a dedicated team of professionals friendly receptionists would recommend this practice

title: This is how you do it!
body:
What an excellent team of professionals at Chew Medical Practice, from front of house through to the highly skilled doctors.  This surgery is an outstanding example of the NHS at it's best; a template for outstanding professionalism.  

The things that matter are at its forefront, kindness, care and understanding.  The systems they have in place - call backs (they give you a time period), leaving samples for testing, test results line all add up to patients being re-assured they are in safe hands.  The team obviously prioritise communication to, key to success.

Today I had a consultation and medication ready for collection within a couple hours of my initial call - feeling better already.

I could go on however would like to say a very 'special' thank you to you all for all the smiles and kindness, they are gratefully received.

author: augustmx66
title: Wonderful service
body:
Just to say after attending the audiology department at Barnstaple that what a very efficient, caring and professional team they have there.  
Couldn't have asked for better, a wonderful service

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Support
body:
Recently had my annual Diabetic review which was great experience from start to finish. From:
- the e-mail/text prompting me to make my annual appointment,
- to the ease of making the appointment which was the following week, 
- attending the appointment the reception and nursing staff were lovely
-  to the text confirming my bloods were fine.
Easy and efficient, i was amazed with the follow up text reassuring me the results were good. I had expected to have to chase this by phone.
Streamlined and efficient, using technology to provide quick and simple prompts and updates.
Thank you !

title: Great Practice
body: Since joining Forest Hall Health Centre the staff have all been so helpful and prompt whenever I have needed anything. Couldn't ask for a better practice.

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The ward is really clean
body: The staff on this ward have all been very helpful, and are taking really good care of me. All the food is great, there so much different things on the menu, the breakfast is also very good, I love the porridge. The ward is really clean, and the facilities are cleaned all the time which is good, as they can get a bit dirty at times.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Amanda McC
title: Ambulance service and A & E doctor
body:
My son had to have ambulance called out on early hours of Thursday morning. The paramedics, David and Jamie, were so fantastic. They put us all at ease and the way they dealt with my son was amazing, telling him exactly what they were doing and speaking to him in a way he would understand. They were honestly so great.  
One thing I was concerned about was the A n E doctor. The triage part was great, literally wasn’t even 5 mins with the doctor. They asked to weigh my son so they could give him the right dose of medicine. I was a bit shocked that I had to tell them he already had the medicine they were going to give him again. Why did they not know this had already been given? They said to me, oh he’s in with this condition, but nothing has been confirmed and I was told he would be checked over which never happened. I got told it’s this and sent on my way.

title: Diabetic eye screening
body: The waiting room for eye screening was upstairs - very small and cramped with people. They were not all patients, some had someone with them. There was no social distancing, only me wearing a face mask and a patient continually coughing. This is worrying given the rising Covid rates

title: Ordering my meds is a nightmare
body: Three times of asking for my prescription, filling out the form, going to reception and writing a letter but still I can’t get my regular prescription , going to reception I was only 4 days after my knee surgery, no prescription now for 6 days, I’ve run out

title: Great Practice
body:
Big shout out to Downing Street Surgery.
I submitted an e consult form at 2:30, received a phone call at 2:45 asking me if I could come to surgery in next 15 mins! I could and by 3:10 I was being seen by GP. Can’t sake for more than that!!!!

author: Linjt76
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Catheter care
body:
My catheter blocks every 2 weeks. I don't know when it happens as I can't feel anything but the nurses try everything to stop it but unfortunately they can't fix it. I have to go into the Emergency Department by ambulance and they get me onto a trolley and I wait for someone to fix it. I was in last week. Everyone is kind but I'd rather not be there. I'm always very tired for a few days after. Be good if there was something else could be done  
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']  
[Very unhappy with 'Waiting time']  
[Very happy with 'Ambulance staff']  
[Very happy with 'Doctor']  
[Very happy with 'Nurses']

readBy.name: Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Amazing nurse
body:
My autistic son had fallen and injured his arm.
The nurse who dealt with him was so patient, thorough and worked fast, understanding his needs.
She was kind and encouraging towards him, keeping him calm and explaining what she was doing when she put a pot on his arm.
The whole visit was completed within an hour and that’s including an X-ray.
She let him see his x-ray and it has really helped his understanding of the whole situation and kept him calm.
Thank you! What could of been a traumatic situation has certainly been a positive one for him! 
I would also like to mention how kind and understanding the receptionist was when I called ahead to explain the situation and the lady who did the x-ray!
10/10 for Whitby Urgent care!

title: Frustrating service
body: Recently, I have used askmygp to contact the surgery for help/advice and booking appointments and I always ask for evening or Friday afternoon appointments as I do not get paid for medical appointments where I work and it seems to be a constant battle to try and get appointments outside office hours, I was give an appointment to see the physio on 15th September at 11.40hrs without the surgery contacting me to discuss a convenient time and I had ring up and wait for almost 20 mins to speak to reception. This is not an isolated incident as my wife also has similar struggles and we are now thinking of changing practice because of these frustrations.

title: Who’s the midwife?!
body: Terrible service! I am 32 weeks pregnant trying to get a blood test for my 28 week check for 5 weeks. I have been hitting brick wall every time I call. Rude receptionists who claim that my midwife only works once every 2 weeks in the surgery. They dun’t know her, or her name’. I have finally got round to booking my bloods but not for another 2 weeks…which will take me up to 34 weeks. This is shocking as my last pregnancy was high risk with preeclampsia and anaemia. I have all symptoms of what I had before and I am currently hoping for the best

title: Great Nurse
body: I came in for my blood tests which I am very nervous about.  I do not remember her name but my visit was 05/09/2022 at 12:10.  She spoke to me about giving up smoking and while we were talking she took my blood without me even noticing.  The best blood tests I have every had.   Thank you

title: Got worse since covid
body: Trying to get  through to the surgery is a waste of time left on hold for a ridiculous amount of time something needs to be sorted at the practice more reception staff needed

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body:
I am utterly at wits end with this surgery. I have been trying to get an appointment for over 8 months, so that i can get a repeat prescription for my asthma. When I call them they tell me they can't help me and that I need to go onto their site. When I go to their site, I need special logins so that I can access the make an appointment section. To get the logins, I need to call them. I call them, they say I need to wait for my logins, which will be sent by email. I waited 6 months for those logins. Everytime I called in betweem they were of no help. The logins they send could not be more confusing, they send a an "ID", a "username", a "password" and a "passphrase". When I try to login using my password and username gain no access. After 5 attempts my accound becomes locked. Only way to unlock it? Why you have to call them of course. Guess how far I got? 

This surgery should be a ashamed of how of complicated it has made it for a person to gain access to health care. I am utterly disgusted by lack of service and complete unwillingness to me get a simple GP appointment.

title: Issues never fixed and they never call back with…
body: Probably the worst practice I’ve signed up to. No one ever picks up the phone and issues are never sorted

title: My experience with Cgl
body:
This service is not equipped to deal with people with complex needs (Neuro-diverse). 
The support and aftercare team are nowhere to be seen or found once you complete your detox with cgl manchester. Cgl dismisses you from the service with no action plan in place for the next steps of your recovery. 
Not everyone is comfortable with attending groups. There should be alternatives in place to accommodate service users’ preferences. 
I have recently been back in touch with cgl to access the "be smoke-free" service, and I was instantly reminded of why I dislike cgl. The only great thing about cgl is the volunteering counselling services they offer, which I was only given due to being persistent. 
I would never recommend the service or refer anyone to this service. The service doesn’t care about you, they just see you as a statistic.

title: I have never been so disgusted by a practice in…
body:
The doctors/nurses themselves are exceptional, I have always been given brilliant care when going for an appointment. However, the receptionist are absolutely vile. 
After my baby’s 1 year check up, the health visitor advised me to have him checked by the doctor as he occasionally has uneven pupils. I’d then taken him in to the doctors and the receptionist has told me to call up at 8am the next morning to make an appointment. I explained that I can never get hold of the doctors, and once I finally get in the call queue, there are no appointments left for the day so I’ve asked for an appointment in advance. I had explained what the problem was to with my sons eyes and she replied “well they look fine to me!”
I never realised the receptionist could give a medical diagnosis like that. She had then booked my baby in for an appointment a week later without even taking his name. 
 
When it was time for my baby to have his first round of injections, I was advised by the nurse he was unable to have his rotavirus treatment. This was because the practice had failed to log his results from his newborn blood spot test on the system however I’d had my copy of the results for weeks. After his 3rd round injections, I kept receiving appointments for his last round of jabs. I’d informed the health visitor and she said to ignore the letter, it’s obviously an error and the appointment will be cancelled when his the practice log his last round of jabs on the system. I kept receiving more and more letters and was then told that he’d have to be revaccinated. I’d then gone into the practice and the receptionist is having argument with me that I’ve wasted NHS time and the appointments could of been given to someone else. However, I did exactly what a health professional told me to do with ignoring the letters as this was an error, and I wouldn’t have been sent the letter if the practice had actually logged the vaccines on the system.

title: Bad Practice
body:
First called regarding me wanting to have an asthma test done as i don't have the diagnosis in this country but being told i couldn't get one.
Went there in person and getting the response that i can't and only if you have an asthma attack that i should call them and they will come back to me within 48hours. But i could be seriously hurt by that time

title: Terrible
body: Rigging the phone at 11am and it’s gone past 12.30 still can’t get through. An absolute joke of a service, do yourself and your family a favour go elsewhere these guys have severe staffing issues, they should be closed down. An hour and a half still no answer, a joke.

title: Disgusted
body:
For more than 30 minutes I have been on the telephone in a queue. I understand that receptionists are busy, but more than 30 is ridiculous. It starts by telling me where I was in the queue but then once at number three no mention of where I was for more than 5 minutes. What was wrong with the old system of the prescription ordering line? At least it was quicker. Finally got through after 34 minutes and told couldn’t get an appointment, not even by telephone for another 4 days. The service at this surgery has dropped dramatically over the last few years and I am surprised that the CQC even rated it as good!!!
Whilst on the phone for 35 minutes I must have been told about the NHS app 30 times… do you people not realise that not everyone has access to an app or can use an app!! Where is the inclusion here?
I am totally frustrated with the service at this surgery and would never ever advise anyone to join the practice.

title: Great service
body: My mum had scan in Nuclear Medicine Department today 5/9/2022 & the service given was next to none. The radiologist was so friendly, helpful & very precise in explaining what she was doing so my mum understood & was put at ease. Thank you for your kindness

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Rude staff and GP
body: We had so many bad experiences for us and also with the kids, the staff is rude and GP are always in a rush, doesn't explain to you what you have, treatment, anything, and never solve your problem or try to help in any sort of way.

title: Gave me the information I needed
body: The practice pharmacist knew exactly the information I required. He gave me the surity I needed from this new medication.

title: Chaos
body:
The website is no good if you have a question and do not want an e consult I.e changing an appointment 
Trying to phone is no good as after half an hour no joy 
Going to the surgery is just as bad as you queue for half an hour as two receptionist see one patient at a time and chat in between. Why are both people not seeing and attending to patients and so moving the queue along.
The electric doors have not been working for months which means you have to pull them open and no hand sanitizer in the reception area so as to able to clean hands 
All in all the surgery seems to be in a very bad way

title: Caring and kind
body: My elderly frail father was taken to A & E Friday night 2 September 2022, following a fall at his nursing home. He could not move and was in excruciating pain in his hip. The nurse looking after him was very kind and efficient and the other chap who was with the nurse was also very good with my father especially as he’s deaf and has communication problems. The nurse kept us informed of what was going even though he was extremely busy.  Just wanted to say thank you

title: Very poor accessibility,phone system impractical…
body: Trying to get a prescription to treat a very uncomfortable bronchitis attack. Going around in circles, keep getting cut off when in the waiting list. So far this morning have had to listen to the same answer phone message, from 2 different drs, 7 times. Unable to speak to anyone. Too busy, so no messages being taken. 111 were helpful, said dr would ring me at 9. Didnt happen. Tried again, this time 111 said it would be a 3 hour slot starting at 9 am! Didnt happen! I have been with this surgery all my life, and have never felt less cared about.I hate to have to write this kind of review. The Drs themselves are wonderful, but the system is a brick wall!

title: No way on telephone or online to contact
body: Tomorrow we have an appointment that we need to confirm. We have rung outpatients appointments phone line. The queuing system said we were number 35 in the queue. An hour later it said we were number 25 in the queue. Another hour and we were number 14 in the queue. Another hour and position in the queue is 5. (How many people work answering the phones and how long do they take with each call??) We used another line to contact the department (while leaving the first on hold) and spoke to four answer phones of different secretaries. We tried to call PALS. No answer. We have emailed PALS, no answer. It looks like we will need to get in the car and drive 30 minutes, park in the hospital car park, go into the department.... at which they will say they have to talk to the patient.... who can easily phone but not easily travel today. Is this a good way to run a professional organisation?

title: Impossible to contact
body: I haven't been able to contact them, despite numerous attempts. They don't answer the phone and don't call back if you leave a request.
